<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 358, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 213, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 146, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 653, 94]]<|/det|>
Sketch the graph of \(y = \left|x - 2a\right|\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 494, 146, 512]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 494, 468, 512]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(2x - 3a < |x - 2a|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 494, 920, 512]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 779, 96]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(a^{2y - 1} = b^{x - y}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 107, 144, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 556, 125]]<|/det|>
Show that the graph of \(y\) against \(x\) is a straight line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 537, 186, 556]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 537, 918, 575]]<|/det|>
Given that \(a = b^{3}\) , state the equation of the straight line in the form \(y = px + q\) , where \(p\) and \(q\) are rational numbers in their simplest form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 554, 920, 573]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 455, 93]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y\mathrm{e}^{2x} + y^2\mathrm{e}^x = 6.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 917, 125]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of the curve at the point where \(y = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 918, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 97, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 144, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 643, 95]]<|/det|>
It is given that the equation \(\mathrm{e}^{2x} = 5 + \cos 3x\) has only one root.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 692, 127]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that this root lies in the interval \(0.7 < x < 0.8\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 325, 141, 344]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 325, 885, 345]]<|/det|>
Show that if a sequence of values in the interval \(0.7 < x < 0.8\) given by the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 350, 598, 378]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \frac{1}{2}\ln \bigl (5 + \cos 3x_{n}\bigr)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 384, 668, 405]]<|/det|>
converges then it converges to the root of the equation in part **(a)**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 384, 920, 403]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 602, 141, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 602, 920, 637]]<|/det|>
Use this iterative formula to determine the root correct to 3 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 5 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 617, 920, 636]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 85, 148, 104]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 77, 442, 107]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{2} x e^{-ax} \, \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 84, 920, 103]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 87, 148, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 78, 703, 114]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact value of \(\int_{-\frac{1}{8}\pi}^{\frac{1}{8}\pi} (\cos^4\theta - \sin^4\theta + 4\sin^2\theta\cos^2\theta)\mathrm{d}\theta .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 77, 92, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 112]]<|/det|>
The points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) have position vectors \(\overrightarrow{OA} = - 2\mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} + 4\mathbf{k}\), \(\overrightarrow{OB} = 5\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OC} = 8\mathbf{i} + 5\mathbf{j} - 3\mathbf{k}\), where \(O\) is the origin. The line \(l_{1}\) passes through \(B\) and \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 123, 144, 141]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 123, 386, 141]]<|/det|>
Find a vector equation for \(l_{1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 123, 920, 141]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 400, 566, 421]]<|/det|>
The line \(l_{2}\) has equation \(\mathbf{r} = - 2\mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} + 4\mathbf{k} + \mu (3\mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} - 2\mathbf{k})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 433, 144, 451]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 432, 623, 451]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the point of intersection of \(l_{1}\) and \(l_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 432, 920, 451]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 479, 91]]<|/det|>
The point \(D\) on \(l_{2}\) is such that \(AB = BD\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 390, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(D\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 710, 94]]<|/det|>
The complex numbers \(z\) and \(\omega\) are defined by \(z = 1 - \mathrm{i}\) and \(\omega = - 3 + 3\sqrt{3}\mathrm{i}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 106, 144, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 757, 125]]<|/det|>
Express \(z\omega\) in the form \(a + bi\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are real and in exact surd form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 291, 144, 310]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 291, 920, 325]]<|/det|>
Express \(z\) and \(\omega\) in the form \(r\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta}\), where \(r > 0\) and \(-\pi < \theta \leqslant \pi\). Give the exact values of \(r\) and \(\theta\) in each case.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 307, 920, 326]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 609, 181, 626]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 609, 801, 628]]<|/det|>
On an Argand diagram, the points representing \(\omega\) and \(z\omega\) are \(A\) and \(B\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 644, 740, 663]]<|/det|>
Prove that \(OAB\) is an isosceles right-angled triangle, where \(O\) is the origin.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 644, 920, 663]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 72, 567, 89]]<|/det|>
